intro: Corydalis gortschakovii subsp. onobrychis, commonly known as the pink corydalis, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats and has a creeping or clump-forming growth habit. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
